result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary L Klotz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and DNA to be paid within 90 days; alternate civil judgment to be entered.

STRAIGHT TIME.
Concurrent with: current sentence

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant appeared by video

Defendant Gary L Klotz by video with attorney Jeremy J Guza in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend charge to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 947.07(1), Wisconsin Statutes.  Court approves amendment.  State to file amended Complaint by the end of business on 4/11/16.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State has complied with victim/witness notification.

  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  90 days, straight time. CONCURRENT to any current sentence.

COURT COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid in 90 days or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid in 90 days or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of surcharge.

**Minutes corrected on 3/21/18 per Judge Maxwell to correct the sentence to "CONCURRENT" time instead of "CONSECUTIVE" time.
